obvious.ivtk.data
Class IvtkObviousNetwork

java.lang.Object
  obvious.ivtk.data.IvtkObviousNetwork
All Implemented Interfaces:
obvious.data.Data, obvious.data.Graph<obvious.data.Node,obvious.data.Edge>, obvious.data.Network, obvious.util.Adaptable
Direct Known Subclasses:
IvtkObviousForest
public class IvtkObviousNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
implements obvious.data.Network

This class is in an implementation of the Network for the Obvious Ivtk binding based on the Ivtk Graph class. Ivtk and Obvious do not share the same granularity of method for graphs. That is why, this class is not a simple wrapper. For example, Ivtk graph does not provide a getSuccessors method as Obvious ones do. Thus, Ivtk methods can not be bound directly to Obvious ones, some complementary Ivtk code should be added to bind them.

beginEdit

public void beginEdit(int col)
               throws obvious.ObviousException
Indicates the beginning of a column edit.

This function could be used to create a context when a large number of modifications happens to a same column to avoid time wasting with plenty of notifications. In this context, TableListeners could ignore notifications if wanted.

Specified by:
beginEdit in interface obvious.data.Network
Parameters:
col - column index
Throws:
obvious.ObviousException - if edition is not supported.

endEdit

public boolean endEdit(int col)
                throws obvious.ObviousException
Indicates the end of a column edit.

This function indicates, if notifications were disabled, that now they are enabled. It could also call a mechanism to replay the sequence of ignored events if wanted.

Specified by:
endEdit in interface obvious.data.Network
Parameters:
col - column index
Returns:
true if transaction succeed
Throws:
obvious.ObviousException - if edition is not supported.

getEdgeType

public obvious.data.Graph.EdgeType getEdgeType(obvious.data.Edge edge)
Indicates if an edge is directed or not. In ivtk graph, all edges follow the same "directed" attributes. There is no distinction between edges in a ivtk graph so in this implementation too.

Specified by:
getEdgeType in interface obvious.data.Graph<obvious.data.Node,obvious.data.Edge>
Parameters:
edge - an edge of the graph
Returns:
the corresponding EdgeType enum value
